name: Sumo Revise
description: Are you the best sumo?! Find out in this quirky multiplayer brawler that's a cross between Super Smash Bros. and QWOP. Duke it out and fight your way to the top!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP / Vista / 7 / 8 / 8.1 Processor: 1.4 GHz Processor Memory: 512 MB RAM Storage: 65 MB available space Sound Card: 100% DirectX compatible card or onboard sound

reviews.review_text: It's bad. Ugly, janky, confusing, and only fun for a laugh at how terrible/lolwackyrandom it is. Music isn't garbage, but everything else is. I think it wishes it were Niddhogg but didn't know how to program anything nearly as competent as that game.

Simple and fun. Has lot sof different modes to keep things interesting. Some of the powerups look REALLY bad because they are really jarring against the rest of the game which is more pixely. If some of the graphics were improved, this game would be even better.

This is a very interesting game that has abot as many pros as cons which has my desision on if it is a good game or not. I will start with the pros.  The graphics are in a very nice 8-bit form that isnt seen very often anymore.  The soundtrack is very nice and catchy, in fact I was humming it as I was writing this review.   The gameplay is very fun with a bunch of power ups to keep it interesting. You can also invite a bunch of your buddies over and they can join you   And now for the cons  The graphics can become a bit disorienting, especially if all the characters look very similar, they sometimes end up being the same color as your character. It gets really annoying.  There is a multiplayer, but it is NOT an online multiplayer, not even a local. It is not internet related at all. Which means you have to crowd a bunch of friends areound the keyboad that you likely only have one of to play this game, so you either just don' play the supposed fun multiplayer or you have to buy a few more keyboards and/or controlers  sometimes the gameplay doesn't make any sense at all, some of the power ups do nothing.    Well the way I see things a good ought weighs a bad so I am going to give this game a 7/10
Sumo Revise is a game that I recommend because: - is a method to banish boredom - have action - have trading cards - is indie & casual  Enjoy!
